definition.sentence: Template Generator , which derives the templates from the semantic structures .
definition.definiens: derives the templates from the semantic structures

definition.sentence: Systems that do full-sentence parsing usually represent their rules either as a phrase structure grammar augmented with constraints on the application of the rules ( Augmented Transition Networks , or ATNs ) , or as unification grammars in which the constraints are represented declaratively .
definition.definiens: a phrase structure grammar augmented with constraints on the application of the rules ( Augmented Transition Networks , or

definition.sentence: The Filter Our filtering mechanism allows the system to ignore all sentences which have no useful mean ing .
definition.definiens: allows the system to ignore all sentences which have no useful mean ing

definition.sentence: The LINK parser LINK is unification-based chart parser , which parses a sentence at a time .
definition.definiens: unification-based chart parser , which parses a sentence at a time

definition.sentence: Edges have associated with them both syntactic and semantic information , represented in the form of a directed acyclic graph ( DAG ) .
definition.definiens: semantic information , represented in the form of a directed acyclic graph

definition.sentence: The MUC-5-LINK parsing strateg y LINK is a bottom-up chart parser which does not use top-down constraints .
definition.definiens: a bottom-up chart parser which does not use top-down constraints

definition.sentence: Because unrestricted bottom-up chart parsing can be ( and is , in our system ) very inefficient , LINK uses heuristics to decide on the next edge to be entered into the chart .
definition.definiens: uses heuristics to decide on the next edge to be entered into the chart

definition.sentence: A rule consists of a left hand side ( lhs ) , which must match ( i .

The two UX modules of the DBG system that were use d for MUC-5 are the Lexical Unexpected Inputs ( LUX ) module and the Word Acquisition Module ( WAM ) , both of which apply at the Lexical Analysis stage .

SEMANTIC PARSE OF EXAMPLE SENTENCE fpl : 'MAINPRED ' ( '1 .0 ' ) _ 'INDEX ' ( '1 .1 ' ) 'SUBJECT/AGENT ' ( '1 .1 ' ) = 'INDEX ' ( '1 .2 ' ) 'NOUN/HAMPSHIRE INSTRUMENTS INC ' = 'Hampshire Instruments ''TENSE ' ( '1 .1 ' ) _ 'PRESENT PERFECT ' 'VOICE ' ( '1 .1 ' ) = 'ACTIVE '' PREDICATE/SELL ' ( '1 .1 ' ) = sell 'OBJECT/PATIENT ' ( '1 .1 ' ) = 'INDEX ' ( '1 .3 ' ) 'DETERMINER ' ( '1 .3 ' ) = an 'NOUN QUALIFIER/X RAY ' ( '1 .3 ' ) = 'x-ray ''NOUN/LITHOGRAPHY SYSTEM ' ( '1 .3 ' ) = 'lithography system ' 'PREPOSITIONAL PHRASE/RECIPIENT ' ( '1 .1 ' ) = 'INDEX ' ( '1 .4 ' ) 'PREPOSITION ' ( '1 .4 ' ) = to 'PREP OBJECT ' ( '1 .4 ' ) = 'INDEX ' ( '1 .5 ' ) 'NOUN/A T AND T BELL LABS ' ( '1 .5 ' ) _ 'AT & T Bell Laboratories ' Figure 3 : DBG Analysis of Sample Sentence 126 Among the principles which are most important in the current version of the parser are the projectio n principle , which constrains which positions in the tree can be assigned thematic roles , the extended projectio n principle , which attempts to link every clause to a subject , trace theory and the theta-criterion , which ensur e that every argument position has a one-to-one correspondence with a theta-role , and X-bar theory , whic h limits branching to binary structures following the X-bar schema .
definition.definiendum: SEMANTIC PARSE OF EXAMPLE SENTENCE fpl
definition.definiens: DBG Analysis of Sample Sentence 126 Among the principles which are most important in the current version of the parser are the projectio n principle , which constrains which positions in the tree can be assigned thematic roles , the extended projectio n principle , which attempts to link every clause to a subject , trace theory and the theta-criterion

definition.sentence: The AGENT is `Hampshire Instruments ' , the PATIENT is `an x-ray lithography system ' , and the RECIPIENT is `AT & T Bell Laboratories ' .
definition.definiens: `AT & T Bell Laboratories '

definition.sentence: An event template includes a set of empty slots which represent the various thematic roles associated wit h the event .
definition.definiens: includes a set of empty slots which represent the various thematic roles associated wit h the event

definition.sentence: The SHOGUN system is a distillation of some of the key ideas that emerged from previous benchmarks and experiments , emphasizing a simple architecture in which the focus is on detailed corpus-based knowledge .
definition.definiens: a distillation of some of the key ideas that emerged from previous benchmarks and experiments , emphasizing a simple architecture in which the focus is on detailed corpus-based knowledge

definition.sentence: This method combines several earlier previous of work , including Pereira 's research on grammar approximation [ 4 ] , som e of the original ideas on parser compilation from Tomita [ 5 ] , and GE 's representation of the dynamic lexico n [ 3 , 1 ] .
TEXTRACT , like SHOGUN , emphasizes lexically-driven pattern matching , and the two systems share a Japanese tagging/segmentation program from NTT Data , called MAJESTY .
definition.definiens: emphasizes lexically-driven pattern matching

definition.sentence: The pattern matcher searches all possibl e patterns of interest in a sentence that match defined patterns such as tie-up relationships and economi c activities .

definition.sentence: Morphological Analyze r The Morphological Analyzer divides a sentence into morphemes and assigns corresponding syntactic information to each morpheme using the syntactic dictionary .
VENIEX gathers the sub_ME_Capability frames and combines them into the ME_Capability frames .
The Local Parser combines sub_ME_Capability frames in one phrase .
definition.definiens: combines sub_ME_Capability frames in one phrase

definition.sentence: The sentence consists of two simple sentences and the extracted information lies in the 2nd simple sentence .
definition.definiens: consists of two simple sentences and the extracted information lies in the 2nd simple sentence

definition.sentence: VENIEX recognizes that these two simple sentences share the nominative case , and combines th e ME_Capability frames according to the path of information ; { `` Q*As # 0 `` _ '' rlLt0 `` - { `` tZ `` `` CVD E `` } } ( { Entity — `` agree '' — { `` manufacture and distribute '' — Equipment } } ) .

definition.definiens: keeps a sub_ME_Capability frame , which appears as an entity or microelectronics in the sentence

definition.sentence: Additionally , for an entity ( sub_ME_Capability frame ) , which is the subjective case in the given sentence , the Parser keeps it in `` currentEnt '' slot .
definition.definiens: the subjective case in the given sentence , the Parser keeps it in `` currentEnt '' slot

definition.sentence: VENIEX makes two mistakes in discourse processing for walkthrough text .
definition.definiens: makes two mistakes in discourse processing for walkthrough text

definition.sentence: While the semantic network represents the static part of the knowledge base , marker passing is th e mechanism which changes the state of the knowledge base with each new word .
definition.definiens: the static part of the knowledge base

definition.sentence: The phrasal parser performs grouping of words , and the memory-based parser gener ates semantic meaning representation by using stored patterns in the knowledge base .
definition.definiens: ates semantic meaning representation by using stored patterns in the knowledge base

definition.sentence: The knowledge base consists of a domain concept hierarchy including location hierarchy , a set of phrasal patterns for TIE-UP , an d semantically relaxed versions of some phrasal patterns .
definition.definiens: a set of phrasal patterns for TIE-UP , an d semantically relaxed versions of some phrasal patterns

definition.sentence: Activation-markers ( A markers ) are used to propagate activations fro m the input phrase to the corresponding concept sequence elements .

definition.sentence: Equipment represents the implementation of a process , whereas devices represent the application of a process .
definition.definiens: the implementation of a process , whereas devices represent the application of a process

definition.sentence: The resolution of coreferences , which also contributes to domain complexity , is a key task in the Joint Ventures domain .
definition.definiens: a key task in the Joint Ventures domain

definition.sentence: LANGUAGE DIFFERENCES Although the Japanese and English tasks are apparently identical ( other than the language of the texts and templates ) , subtle differences emerge with closer scrutiny of the corpora , template definitions , and fill rules ( see `` Corpor a and Data Preparation '' paper in this volume ) for each of the two languages .
definition.definiens: other than the language of the texts and templates ) , subtle differences emerge with closer scrutiny of the corpora , template definitions , and

definition.sentence: A format difference in slot fills between languages ( for both JV and ME ) is exhibited in the ENTITY object 's NAME slot , where English requires a normalized form for the entity name , based on a standardized list of abbreviations for corporate designators , including more familiar ones like INC ( incorporated ) and LTD ( limited ) , as well a s some specifically used by foreign firms , such as AG ( for Aktiengesellschaft -Germany ) , EC ( for Exempt Company Bahrain ) , and PERJAN ( for Perusuhan Jawatan -Indonesia ) .
definition.definiens: requires a normalized form for the entity name , based on a standardized list of abbreviations for corporate designators , including more familiar ones like INC ( incorporated ) and LTD ( limited )

definition.sentence: The EME corpus , on the other hand , is selected from a business and trade database with more than 200 different sources .
definition.definiens: selected from a business and trade database with more than 200 different sources

definition.sentence: A semantic rule creates a semantic representation of the phrase as an annotation on the syntactic parse .

definition.sentence: The second sub-component of the semantic interpreter module is a pattern-based sentence interpreter which applies semantic pattern-action rules to the semantics of each fragment of the sentence .
definition.definiens: a pattern-based sentence interpreter which applies semantic pattern-action rules to the semantics of each fragment of the sentence

definition.sentence: The message level representation is a list of discourse domain objects ( DDOs ) for the top-level events of interest in the message ( e .
definition.definiens: a list of discourse domain objects ( DDOs ) for the top-level events of interest in the message

definition.sentence: Template Generation The template generator takes the DDOs produced by discourse processing and fills out the application-specifi c templates .
definition.definiens: takes the DDOs produced by discourse processing and fills out the application-specifi c templates

definition.sentence: Some of the lessons we learned during our work include the following : Automatic training and acquisition of knowledge bases can yield relatively good performance at reduced labor , a s evidenced , for example , by a quick port to the microelectronics domain ( in 2 languages ) in 2 person-month s ( after which further refinements were made ) .
definition.definiens: after which further refinements were made )

definition.sentence: If a full parse can not be created , SOLOMON uses a fragment combination strategy .
definition.definiens: uses a fragment combination strategy

definition.sentence: LEXTooI , the lexicon acquisition tool , is multilingual and relies on system data files for category and morphological information .
definition.definiens: multilingual and relies on system data files for category and morphological information

definition.sentence: The choice of acronym is somewhat misleading , however , because FASTUS is a system for information extraction , not text understanding .
definition.definiens: a system for information extraction

definition.sentence: FASTUS is a trademark of SRI International .

The PHRASE PARSER then breaks the input stream into Noun Groups ( the part of the noun phrase consisting of determiner , prenominal modifiers and head noun ) Verb Groups ( auxiliaries , intervening adverbs , with main verb ) and particles ( single lexical items , including conjunctions , prepositions , subordinating conjunctions , and relative pronouns ) .
definition.definiens: the part of the noun phrase consisting of determiner , prenominal modifiers and head noun

definition.sentence: The PHRASE COMBINER takes the phrases output b y the PHRASE PARSER and combines them into larger phrases of the same type .
definition.definiens: takes the phrases output b y the PHRASE PARSER and combines them into larger phrases of the same type

definition.sentence: The TOKENIZE R The TOKENIZER is a simple transducer that accepts ASCII characters as input and produces a stream of tokens as output .
definition.definiens: a simple transducer that accepts ASCII characters as input and produces a stream of tokens as output

definition.sentence: The PREPROCESSO R The PREPROCESSOR accepts the tokens produced by the TOKENIZER as input and produces lexica l items as output .
definition.definiens: accepts the tokens produced by the TOKENIZER as input and produces lexica l items as output

definition.sentence: Therefore , the PREPROCESSO R uses separate transducers for recognizing personal and corporate names for mixed-case and uppercase-only texts .
definition.definiens: uses separate transducers for recognizing personal and corporate names for mixed-case and uppercase-only texts

definition.sentence: 225 The phrase parser constructs phrases that can be reliably described as a regular language .
definition.definiens: a regular language

definition.sentence: The PHRASE COMBINE R The PHRASE COMBINER attempts to simplify the job of the final domain pattern recognizer by combining phrases from the initial parse into larger phrases whenever this is feasible .
definition.definiens: attempts to simplify the job of the final domain pattern recognizer by combining phrases from the initial parse into

definition.sentence: The DOMAIN PATTERN RECOGNIZER takes the output of the PHRASE COMBINER as input , and produces raw templates as output .
definition.definiens: takes the output of the PHRASE COMBINER as input , and produces raw templates as output

definition.sentence: Thus , the earlier phase s of the PATTERN RECOGNIZER could be used to implement extremely general , loose patterns that coul d serve as defaults that could be defeated by the output of more precise , specific patterns at higher levels .
definition.definiens: loose patterns that coul d serve as defaults that could be defeated by the output of more precise , specific patterns at higher levels

definition.sentence: The POSTPROCESSO R The output of the PATTERN RECOGNIZER is raw templates .
definition.definiens: raw templates

definition.sentence: The CBAS architecture depicted in Figure 1 emphasizes the use of multiple processors to detect significant primitive facts which are then processed by reasoning modules implemented as collections of forward-chaining rules to infer additional information .
definition.definiens: collections of forward-chaining rules to infer additional information

definition.sentence: A second , intensional reasoning phase involves the use of forward-chaining rules to infer information about possible events and their component objects an d attributes from the basic facts generated in the initial phase .
definition.definiens: involves the use of forward-chaining rules to infer information about possible events and their component objects an d attributes from the basic facts generated in the initial phase

definition.sentence: Tokenization The initial , tokenization phase consists of a collection of processors , each of which contributes what i t can to the set of primitive facts which form the basis for higher-level reasoning .
definition.definiens: consists of a collection of processors , each of which contributes what i t can to the set of primitive facts which form the basis for higher-level reasoning

definition.sentence: In CBAS , calls are made within CLIPS images to external UNIX DBM databases , whic h are used to store static knowledge ( just like the company name parser stores relatively static knowledge about known companies ) .
definition.definiens: databases , whic h are used to store static knowledge

definition.sentence: The LHS of a rule consist s primarily of patterns that facts in the factbase might satisfy , and the RHS of a rule consists of actions t o be performed if all the expressions constituting the LHS of the rule do match existing facts , and of cours e a common action performed on the RHS of a rule is to assert new facts and/or to remove existing fact s which match the patterns on the rule 's LHS .
definition.definiens: a rule consist s primarily of patterns that facts in the factbase might satisfy

consists of actions t o be performed if all the expressions constituting the LHS of the rule do match existing facts , and of cours e a common action performed on the RHS of a rule is to assert new facts and/or to remove existing fact s which match the patterns on the rule 's LHS

definition.sentence: A < notation is used to provide a way of pointing to the fact instantiatin g a given pattern on the LHS so that on the RHS the fact can be modified or deleted . In the following rule , the 1 ( eft ) and r ( ight ) attributes of txt_token facts are used to require two wor d tokens to be contiguous. This rule illustrates a rudimentary form of syntactic analysis in which words i n domain-specific classes are combined to infer constituent structures . Constraining the tokens to specifi c word classes is done by unifying the reg attributes of txt_token and word facts , where word facts encode the class information . In this particular case , the only words of type `` joint '' are joint , co-operative , and new , and the only words of type `` venture '' are venture , project , plan , deal , firm , concern , and development. And the set of possible phrases recognized by this rule is the Cartesian product of these two word classes . Do not confuse the use of the term `` template structure '' in CLIPS with the use of the same terns in MI JC applicationsi n the latter case , it refers to output structures which are intended to represent generalized data base records . 253 ( defrule const-joint-venture ( control-fact ( phase const ) ) ( txt_token ( p ? p ) ( s ? s ) ( l ? vl ) ( r ? v2 ) ( cite ? tl ) ( reg ? rl ) ) ( word ( type `` joint '' ) ( reg ? rl ) ) ( txt_token ( p ? p ) ( s ? s ) ( l ? v2 ) ( r ? v3 ) ( cite ? t2 ) ( reg ? r2 ) ) ( word ( type `` venture '' ) ( reg ? r2 ) ) == > ( bind ?
definition.definiens: a rudimentary form of syntactic analysis in which words i n domain-specific classes are combined to infer constituent structures
the use of the same terns in MI JC applicationsi n the latter case , it refers to output structures which are intended to represent generalized data base records

definition.sentence: DEFT provides an application programming interface ( API ) in the form of a library of utilities which allows a custom extraction phase to interact with the dat a structure which is common to all extraction phases , and which is used t o communicate between phases .
definition.definiens: provides an application programming interface ( API ) in the form of a library of utilities which allows a custom extraction phase to interact with the dat a structure which is common to all extraction phases , and which is used t o communicate between phases

definition.sentence: The Tag File is a cumulative record of the processing performed by each extractio n phase .
MO_ batches messages as they come in so as to optimize the use of the 1 .

definition.sentence: Scoping is the process of determining the extent in th e text of a concept associated with a pattern .
definition.definiens: the process of determining the extent in th e text of a concept associated with a pattern

definition.sentence: DEFT provides a high-speed pattern searching capability which ca n successfully extract data from structured or tightly constrained textual inputs , whil e providing pre-processing services ( e .
definition.definiens: provides a high-speed pattern searching capability which ca n successfully extract data from structured or tightly constrained textual inputs

definition.sentence: The DEFT frame definition file format was extended to accommodate hierarchica l relationships ; any frame defined as a child of another frame had its generated fram e ID automatically included as a slot value in the parent frame if its `` hit location '' fel l within the scope of the parent frame .
definition.definiens: a child of another frame had its generated fram e ID automatically included as a slot value in the parent frame if its `` hit location '' fel l within the scope of the parent frame

definition.sentence: Dictionary Files The primary source of our dictionary information about open-class words ( nouns , verbs , adjectives , and adverbs ) is the machine-readable version of the Oxfor d Advanced Learner 's Dictionary ( `` OALD '' ) .
definition.definiens: dictionary information about open-class words ( nouns , verbs , adjectives , and adverbs
the machine-readable version of the Oxfor d Advanced Learner 's Dictionary ( `` OALD '' )

definition.sentence: The matching process proceeds in five steps : dictionary lookup , lexical pattern matching , spelling correction , prefix stripping , and defaul t definition assignment .

definition.sentence: ALL OBJECTS is a stricter manner o f scoring because it penalizes for both the slot fills missing in the missing objects and the slots filled in the spuriou s object .
Error Metrics The error per response fill ( ERR ) is the official measure of MUC-5 system performance .
definition.definiens: the official measure of MUC-5 system performance

definition.sentence: The fifth metric , the F-measure , is a combined score for the entire system and is listed at the bottom of the report .
definition.definiens: a combined score for the entire system and is listed at the bottom of the report

definition.sentence: Recall ( REC ) is the percentage of possible answers which were correct .
definition.definiens: the percentage of possible answers which were correct

definition.sentence: Precision ( PRE ) is the percentage of actual answers given which were correct .
definition.definiens: the percentage of actual answers given which were correct

definition.sentence: The formula for calculating the F-measure is : ( 132 +1 .0 ) xPx R ( 02 xP ) + R where P is precision , R is recall , and is the relative importance given to recall over precision .
definition.definiens: 132 +1 .0 ) xPx R ( 02 xP ) + R where P is precision , R is recall , and is the relative importance given to recall over precision

definition.sentence: However , the potential effect on the MUC-5 evaluation is damped somewhat b y the fact that the MUC-5 template consists of objects that are aligned separately ; response objects that contain an insufficient amount of slot-fillers to warrant an alignment with a key object are not scored against a key object at th e slot level .
definition.definiens: consists of objects that are aligned separately ; response objects that contain an insufficient amount of slot-fillers to warrant an alignment with a key object are not scored against a key object at th e slot level

definition.sentence: The task o f extraction is a complex one that includes elements of information detection and classification , plus open-ende d generation of strings and object pointers .
definition.definiens: includes elements of information detection and classification , plus open-ende d generation of strings and object pointers

definition.sentence: Note also that DEVICE and EQUIPMENT slots are pointers to other objects ( with more slots ) and the TYPE slot is a required slot that is indicative of the actual existence of a particular process within a text .
Systems perform better in Japanese in identifying the tie-up itself , participants in the tie-up , thei r relationship , and industry of the tie-up activity .
definition.definiens: perform better in Japanese in identifying the tie-up itself , participants in the tie-up , thei r relationship , and industry of the tie-up activity

definition.sentence: Measurement takes the following statistics from the training corpus into account : • number of text types • vocabulary size • average sentence length • average number of sentences per tex t Text corpus dimensions measures difficulty in terms of the volume of material to be processed in order t o achieve coverage and monitor system progress .
definition.definiens: takes the following statistics from the training corpus into account : • number of text types • vocabulary size • average sentence length • average number of sentences per tex t Text corpus dimensions measures difficulty in terms of the volume of material to be processed in order t o achieve coverage and monitor system progress

definition.sentence: The F-measure is a weighted combination of recall and precision .
definition.definiens: a weighted combination of recall and precision

definition.sentence: From these graphs it is clear that undergeneration ( UND ) generally correlates with the overall metric of error per response fill ( ERR ) , overgeneration ( OVG ) does not correlate with it , and substitution ( SUB ) correlates with it only to a limited extent .
definition.definiens: the overall metric of error per response fill (

definition.sentence: Figures 6-9 graph error per response fill together with the diagnostic secondary metrics of undergeneration , overgeneration , and substitution for the Tipster systems for each of the two configurations .

definition.sentence: The only other sizeable differences ( i.e. , differences of more than five points ) are the overgeneration score for the GE/CMU EJV and JJV systems ( nine points lower on the coretemplate test for EJV and seven points lower for JJV ) and both the overgeneration and substitution scores for th e GE/CMU optional JJV run using the CMU TEXTRACT system ( overgeneration nine points lower on the core template test and substitution seven points lower ) .
definition.definiens: nine points lower on the coretemplate test for EJV and seven points lower for JJV

definition.sentence: The parser consists of C language routines made available through the Consortium for Lexical Research .
A transitive verb , for example is treated as the V/N category , i.e. , as a function that takes a noun phrase argument on the right ( the N term ) and produces a verb phrase ( the V term ) .
definition.definiens: a function that takes a noun phrase argument on the right ( the N term ) and produces a verb phrase ( the V term )

definition.sentence: Alembic is a clean system : we have among the highest precision scores to be presented here ( P=58 ) .

definition.sentence: `` Error '' includes the following : ( 1 ) Analysts missing information contained in or erroneously interpreting the meaning of an article ; ( 2 ) Analysts forgetting or misapplying a fill rule ; ( 3 ) Analysts misspelling a word or making a keyboarding ( typographical ) error or th e analogous error with a mouse ; and ( 4 ) Analysts making an error in constructing the object-oriented structure , such as failing to create an object , failing to reference an object , providing an incorrect reference to an object .
definition.definiens: includes the following : ( 1 ) Analysts missing information contained in or erroneously interpreting the meaning of an article
such as failing to create an object

definition.sentence: Recall is a measure of the extent to which all relevant information in an article has been extracted , while precision is a measure of the extent to which information that has been entered into a template is correct .
definition.definiens: a measure of the extent to which all relevant

consistency increased by an average of 4 .375 percentage points , indicating that the less-skille d analysts had increased their consistency with the more-skilled analysts

the scored slots in each object

definition.definiens: not allowed to offer optional or alternate fills ( answers )

definition.sentence: • The semantic analyzer takes as inputs , the set of lexical items and a shared packed parse forest , rather than a parse tree or fragments of a parse tree of the input sentence .
definition.definiens: takes as inputs , the set of lexical items and a shared packed parse forest

definition.sentence: A lexical item is a pair : < surface-string , attribute-vector > , where surface-string is an interval [ i , j ] denoting the i'th to j'th word in the sentence ; Lexical Analyzer SemanticAnalyzer Semantic Network Plan1 ecagnizcr Templates ` .
definition.definiens: an interval [ i , j ] denoting the i'th to j'th word in the sentence

definition.sentence: The format of an lexical entry is as follows : ( < key words > ( func < arguments > ) ) Two example entries are shown below : ( aluminum ( meaning MucMeaning ( ( mucnode `` bonding '' ) ( bonding ALUMINUM ) ) ) ( meaning MucMeaning ( ( mucnode `` film '' ) ( film ALUMINUM ) ) ) ( phrases ( Aluminum Co of America ) ( aluminum copper ) ( aluminum silicon ) ) ) ( epitaxy , chemical beam ( meaning MucMeaning ( ( muctype layering ) +equip +layer ( mucnode `` equipment '' ) ( equipment EPITAXIAL_SYSTEM ) ) ) ) The function meaning returns a Meaning object .

Irrelevant sentence filtering : When a non-1C word or phrase , such as `` printed circuit board , '' is foun d in a sentence , the sentence is assumed to be irrelevant and all the lexical items are removed .
definition.definiens: When a non-1C word or

definition.sentence: A tree is a generalized subtree of the network if the nodes in the tree are labeled with the nodes in the network and every directed path in the tree is also a directed path in the network .
definition.definiens: a generalized subtree of the network if the nodes in the tree are labeled with the nodes in the network and every directed path in the tree is also a directed path in the network

definition.sentence: A message is a pair tha t represents an explanation of a subset of the lexical items : ( [ b , e ] , av ) 266 where [ b , e ] is an integer interval representing the span of the lexical items it explains and av is an attribute value vector representing the properties of the explanation .
definition.definiens: an integer interval representing the span of the lexical items it explains
an attribute value vector representing the properties of the explanation

definition.sentence: The semantic interpreter then found a generalized subtree of the semantic network that connects the lexical items : ( deaig `` INC '' ) ( mucnode `` entity '' ) ) 267 The six of the lexical items can be connected by the following tree ( the structure of the tree is indicate d by indentation ) : me-cap ( ( count 6 ) ) entities ( ( count 1 ) ) entity Applied Materials , Inc .
definition.definiens: me-cap ( ( count 6

definition.sentence: As a result , NUBA fails to infer that the type of the previous lithography process is LASER and generates a spurious microelectronic capability template .
definition.definiens: fails to infer that the type of the previous lithography process is LASER and generates a spurious microelectronic capability template

definition.sentence: The software consists of three parts : Utilities : such as generic list , LISP-like command interpreter , bit vectors , attribute value vectors , lexicons , graphs , hash tables , binary searched files etc. ( 16,000 lines ) .
definition.definiens: consists of three parts : Utilities : such as generic list , LISP-like command interpreter , bit vectors , attribute value vectors , lexicons , graphs , hash tables , binary searched files etc. ( 16,000 lines )
